briefdescription.para: This parameter should be determined heuristically from the kernel execution times.

detaileddescription.para: This value is best for small systems on a single AMD Radeon R9 290X (and about 5% faster than 40, which is the default for CUDA devices). Larger simulation systems were quite insensitive to the value of this parameter.

briefdescription.para: Returns true if LJ combination rules are used in the non-bonded kernels.
Free device buffers.

detaileddescription.para: If the pointers to the size variables are NULL no resetting happens.

memberdef.argsstring: (cl_mem *d_dest, void *h_src, size_t type_size, int *curr_size, int *curr_alloc_size, int req_size, cl_context context, cl_command_queue s, bool bAsync=true, cl_event *copy_event=NULL)
memberdef.name: ocl_realloc_buffered

briefdescription.para: Reallocation device buffers.

detaileddescription.para: Reallocation of the memory pointed by d_ptr and copying of the data from the location pointed by h_src host-side pointer is done. Allocation is buffered and therefore freeing is only needed if the previously allocated space is not enough. The H2D copy is launched in command queue s and can be done synchronously or asynchronously (the default is the latter). If copy_event is not NULL, on return it will contain an event object identifying the H2D copy. The event can further be used to queue a wait for this operation or to query profiling information. OpenCL equivalent of cu_realloc_buffered.

briefdescription.para: Releases the input OpenCL buffer.
Tabulates the Ewald Coulomb force and initializes the size/scale and the table GPU array.

detaileddescription.para: If called with an already allocated table, it just re-uploads the table.

briefdescription.para: Initializes the atomdata structure first time, it only gets filled at pair-search.
Copies all parameters related to the cut-off from ic to nbp.
Returns the kinds of electrostatics and Vdw OpenCL kernels that will be used.

detaileddescription.para: Respectively, these values are from enum eelOcl and enum evdwOcl.
